message: One way to think of this silly issue.....on Dec 25th it's Christmas. On other days in December it's the holidays.

It's not honey, it's vinegar so we're clear :) Belfast is a wonderfully diverse place actually. Full of culture, art, a wonderful gay community, a wonderful Hebrew community. Sure we're %99 white, but so is the rest of Maine...probably explains some of our white privilege issues ;)

First off you don't see emissions coming out of the tailpipe you see steam and particulates and emissions are gases that are usually colorless unless they are in a concentrated area( could be wrong) . The idea this kid has that he wants to do is good but the way he's trying to go about doing it is completely WRONG( if I am mistaken please correct me but they did not really explain how it was supposed to work in the video). Photosynthesis cannot occur without light and the device he's building is completely sealed from light, unless this device uses some high heat resistant algae that doesn't use light they will be killed by the heat of the engine. The algae have to be resistant to the steam the nitric acid , unburned hydrocarbons and the CO that come out of the tailpipe which would take the acid level out of viable range unless he is using extreme volcanic algae. This idea would be better suited in some kind of air purification tower rather than the end of somebody's tailpipe.

Besides, let's be honest here...Not many people marry anymore with the genuine intent to preserve their relationship and honor each other above all else. I've been married twice. First time was a mistake because we had nothing in common. Second time was a whirlwind and when it was good it was really good, but I found out way too late when I was most vulnerable that she had no intention of taking any responsibility for our marriage, but she had every intention of taking as much property and money as she could. And yes, I know, don't let my cynicism ruin anyone else's dream...I just think it's a good idea to be smart. Though if you have to consider a prenup, you probably shouldn't be getting married anyway.
